text: <@U13Q594J2> - what version of NodeJS are you running?
<@U13Q594J2|ratnakar> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/ratnakar/F2YML0VFS/pasted_image_at_2016_11_07_02_10_pm.png|Pasted image at 2016-11-07, 2:10 PM>
should I update my  `npm` version ?
you should probably try node v6.7 or higher
which should bring in npm 3.0 as well
ok I shall try thank you <@U0PB67X4K>
<@U0PB67X4K>  now I have npm version `3.10.9` , However I still see the same issue
the engineStrict error is fine.  not sure about the other error though
`engineStrict` is a warning which I don't see any more now after upgrading npm version
thanks <@U0PB67X4K> for the response, yeah the Buffer.from() API is fairly new, like 6.5 or something
check your NodeJS version
6.7 is what we are using now (and in CI as well)
same for me (the latest)
Thank you <@U0PB67X4K> <@U13TWBRBL> . All tests are passing now

I had 6.x version on my machine and downgraded to 4.4.x couple of week ago .. not considered upgrading to 6.x again since the README suggests the min supported version 4.3 or later  `node runtime version 4.3 or later (which also installs the npm tool)` .  I think we should update the documentation to reflect this

text: <@U2YGDD4J0> is there a specific reason you can’t upgrade to v0.6 for both fabric and hfc?

FYI - I created a PR against the marbles repository sample.  The change is to use hfc instead of the old/dated ibm-blockchain-js Node SDK.  
<https://github.com/IBM-Blockchain/marbles/pull/39>

text: <@U2YGDD4J0> so if you are using bluemix starter service (what’s described in the readme above) just to kick the tires, you can wait for a day or two when the service will have been upgraded to fabric v0.6, and you can use hfc v0.6 to write application code to work with it. that should improve your development experience by a lot in terms of robustness of the hfc library
or if you wan to try v0.6 today you can set up the target network locally using docker
<http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/v0.6/starter/fabric-starter-kit/>
<@U1NC8D6V9|anand_fast> has joined the channel
